Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) with traces of added white bands near bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; trace of white slip on underside; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a heavy chalice. Theses types of vessels are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style. The incline of the foot suggests that its upper section was very narrow and unlikely to have held a heavy chalice The number 383 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.2.15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0649) (phase 2)
